# Supervised Learning

@shaunLatham, @GlenArch

## Introduction

This chapter aims to demonstrate competency with supervised learning techniques.

The workflow is captured using Jira under the issue <a/href=https://shaun-latham.atlassian.net/browse/DSS-7>DSS-7</a>:
<ul>
- <a/href=https://shaun-latham.atlassian.net/browse/DSS-14>DSS-14</a> - Identify compatible datasets
- <a/href=https://shaun-latham.atlassian.net/browse/DSS-16>DSS-16</a> - Identify predictor and target variables.
- <a/href=https://shaun-latham.atlassian.net/browse/DSS-17>DSS-17</a> - Decide on algorithms and scoring metrics.
- <a/href=https://shaun-latham.atlassian.net/browse/DSS-18>DSS-18</a> - Tidy and clean the datasets.
- <a/href=https://shaun-latham.atlassian.net/browse/DSS-19>DSS-19</a> - Engineer features where appropriate.
- <a/href=https://shaun-latham.atlassian.net/browse/DSS-20>DSS-20</a> - Build and train models.
- <a/href=https://shaun-latham.atlassian.net/browse/DSS-21>DSS-21</a> - Evaluate and visualise models.
</ul>

It was decided to target the following techniques:
<ul>
- Partial Least-Squares (@GlenArch)
- Linear / Quadratic Regression (@ShaunLatham)
- Support Vector Machines (@ShaunLatham, @GlenArch)
- Decision Tree Classifiers (@GlenArch)
- Logistic Regression (@ShaunLatham)
- K-nearest neighbours (@ShaunLatham, @GlenArch)
</ul>
